description:
I've been coming here for a long time, since I was in high school. The place has changed A LOT since then, adding a lot more than just boba on the menu. There is now ice cream and food on the menu. 
I know a lot of people here are complaining about the syrup that they hide in the back, but honestly for $2.99 you are able to get a variety of toppings, a select of fruit teas, and a chubby cup. For only $2.99!! That's pretty much stealing, I don't know how they make money but they do because I always come back.

Cons: The boba flavors taste like they mix it without a recipe, I bet if they tried to make it better it would win some people over. They had too much on the menu it's kind of overwhelming. 
Pros: 
They do have fast service and great customer service.
Prices are super fair for taste and quality. 
For about $6 you can get a boba drink and a California roll, so how can I give this place less than four stars?
author: Alberto S.

description:
This is my ... 4th time? here ... 
the drinks good, nothing to be crazy about. 
But I'm not amused by their open topping bar
I know lots of places are starting to do that but that's so unsanitary....
author: Fiona B.

description:
My kids live this place, they got me into the taro tea with extra boba which is really good!
They close around 7pm.

Customer Service is not very good, they seem to be just getting through the day because they have to be there- they aren't friendly at all. 

Bring cash, they don't accept cards!
author: Susie C.

description: My family and I like coming here for dessert after dinner at Ling Ling Chinese restaurant.  It's the best deal in the city for boba! You could choose 4 drinks for only $1.99 including boba. Original, taro, jasmine milk tea (forgot what the fourth option is). It's similar to Teaway that you could add as much toppings as you like up to the line. Toppings include big boba, small boba, grass jelly,  almond jelly,  egg pudding etc. My favorite is almond milk tea with boba. It's only $1 for an ice cream cone with one scoop.  There are only 4 flavors though: green tea,  vanilla,  chocolate,  and strawberry.
author: Jennifer T.

description:
Cheap drinks. Unlimited toppings up to the fill line. CASH only. Also I ordered a oolong tea crema, but got an oolong tea with WHIP CREAM instead. When I brought it up to the cashier, he pointed to a sign "this menu are probably not the same as the photos they are shown".

My friend's says the spam and egg rice for $3.50 is really good!
author: Esther Y.

description:
So, I came in here because the other Boba spot like two stores down was closed. I was a little excited because I've always wanted to try this place. They seem cool and super fun from the outside. Once inside it all kind of changed. The service was...blah. The moods don't match the vibes this place was giving off which honestly sucked. Like, hellooo I'm ordering a fruity drink with fun toppings can I least feel good ordering it. Nothing worst than smiling at a cashier and being met with a cold stare. 

The Order: I ordered an avocado smoothie with boba. I didn't get asked what size, how sweet or even if I wanted to try any other toppings. So I just waited to see what was thrown at me. When I got it it looked great. (See picture), but it tasted a lot less great than it looked. I'm honestly wondering if they put baking soda in their mix because this sure as heck wasn't fresh. 

The Bottom line: Dont expect too many pleasantries, unless they read this and fix it, and don't order the smoothies.
author: Veronica S.

description:
This is a good boba spot if you're on the go. When you're craving boba and you need a quick fix. Here's the place to stop! This is only one of two places there is where you can still fill your own toppings. 

You can choose the size of your cup and whatever you want in it. the price is reasonable for the toppings and size of drink you get. The milk teas here aren't the "natural" ones but the powdered one. So don't expect much. 

The food here is super cheap! Like I said if you're looking for a quick fix or bite, this place is good for that. Their spam musubi is alright, (2.50) for two pieces is cheap. Although the rice is a bit vinegary and there was no teriyaki sauce with it. 


Their minced pork is only $2.75, it's filled half with minced pork and half rice with half a tea egg. *beware this is super salty.. The drink helps even out the saltyness but it's still decent. Only would eat when I'm hungry haha...
author: Jenny S.

description: So the drinks are sub par mainly because they taste like they were made from a powdered mix that's been watered down. However they came out with a few fruit drinks that I enjoy like the orange passion fruit tea and mixed fruit tea. I like that the drinks have pieces of fruit in it that I can snack on for later. While the drink menu doesn't have many good drinks, their food is pretty good. I usually order  their California rolls and tea eggs. I would however avoid the ice cream dishes. The ice cream doesn't even taste like the flavor they are suppose to be most times and it's super low quality.
author: Mabel F.

description: Love there mini plates of hot food! Yummy! And drinks too which they have $1.99 special! Very fun store with many selection. Definitely fun for kids! Mama papa shop.
author: Tena A.

description:
Insanely popular with my children (especially my daughter) and their school friends. They like the boba from another place better, but this place is in our neighborhood.

They started buying the small eats and snacks while here as well. 

I finally tried a Green Tea with Honey and Lychee Jelly and really liked it. :)
author: Lu-Shien T.

description: It's always the go to tea house on San Bruno Ave bc they give a lot of options. I love their ice cream since it's only $1 per scoop but today I wanted something else. I got the Yakult Lychee Green Tea(24oz) and then banana chocolate crepe for under $10. The drink was good, pretty much tastes like yakult and the crepe was ehh. It could've been better but it's alright. Service here is okay too. They have tables inside and one table outside with chairs.
author: Lisa W.

description: Late review: been coming here since they open. It's not bad nothing wow. Their boba is hit or miss since sometime it's hard. The tea flavor is ok. My friend love their coffee milk tea as for me everything was ok. Service is ok too. For people who is new to this place: you pick an size you like empty cup than fill it up with topping but remember it's extra cost if it pass the line, than you give them your cup and tell them what drink you like. Yes cool part you get to pick your topping is definitely a plus. Overall 3 star.
author: Christy V.

description: I don't recommend this. I ordered two drinks and 1 order of spam musubi. The drink only took a few minutes but I had to wait an hour for my spam musubi. I was expecting it to be fast because there was only one other customer. After receiving my drinks, I asked for a bag. Then, I sat down and wait. 50 minutes later, the cashier who took my order noticed I was still there and asked, "What are you waiting for?" I responded with, "Spam Musubi". She checked the computer and then stared at my bag to see if I got it already or not and if I was trying to scan them. After 5 minutes, it finally came out. I did not appreciate how the cashier stared at my bag like I was trying to steal.
author: Jacky L.

description:
People cut in front of you and the Owner does not care.  She just serves the one who just  cut the line! 
What is joke!!! No more business from me haha
author: Bryant P.

description: Ordered an oolong tea crema, and they gave me a oolong tea with whip cream on top. If I wanted whip cream, I would have asked for whip cream. You are warned, do not come here.
author: Tiffany T.

description: Everything almost has syrup and they hide the kitchen. I hate when milk tea places do that because it is obvious that they have crappy quality items filled with fake flavors.  No other teas than regular black tea. And green tea.
author: Anthony M.

description:
This review is for the avocado banana smoothies ONLY. This is my favorite place to get it! This used to be Lolocup back when I was in high school and I was sad when it closed, but this place makes them just as good. 

They have self-serve toppings, but there's a limit on how much you're allowed to put. You obviously can't fill your cup halfway with boba, that's ridiculous. The whole concept of self-serve is always fun, but sometimes I worry about how sanitary it is to leave the toppings out in the open for everyone to scoop..

This place is usually filled with middle school kids on weekday afternoons. It's on a busy street and can be difficult to find parking sometimes. 

Don't ever get the chubby cup instead of the large because they're basically the same amount. Not worth it to pay extra for something that seems to be larger in size width wise.

Cash only! And if you get what I like to get here, get it with lychee jelly! Don't accidentally mistake it for pineapple...I did this last time :(
author: Sydney C.

description: If you like fake tasting boba this place is perfect for you the cashier girl has such an attitude, kids will love the boba there though because it taste artificial lol!
author: Malika R.

description: My son's favorite place to go with his Volleyball teammates.  His favorite dish is the fried rice and boba drinks.  I like that it is super clean. People make yo feel you are part of their family. I would highly recommend this place over Starbucks any day!
author: Mai Q.

description: Its ok ! I love Tpumps better! but this place is the only close one to our house so we still might come back here. its not that bad.
author: Lara J.

description: Order Service is efficient but the food processing is super slow.... i called to order Carlifornia rolls, they told me it would be ready in half hour.  In fact, it took them an hour to get the food ready!!
author: Veronica Y.

description: I got boba milk tea with my friends. My boyfriend ordered for me and he had to step out really quick. I noticed his drinks were ready but they messed up mine. The new guy thought it was supposed to be mango but I ordered a honey milk tea. They didn't tell me or my boyfriend what happened. I saw and listened to what happened. So the guy went back and dumped the drink and didn't even replace the toppings. I got the tea back and you can tell they messed up because you can see a mixture of a drink. Anyways, we don't really go to this place. Their milk tea is not good. Their snacks are decent though. If you want decent boba go to the place next door. At least they're honest with their customers.
author: Angelina G.

description: I just had the nastiest sharkfin-imitate soup there, it was watery, full of soy sauce smell, and nasty looking... I asked the cashier if I received the correct order, then I was straight up ignored. The cashier went into the kitchen and left the front counter unattended. What the hell???... I tossed that stuff in the trash.
author: Alex Z.

description:
mmmm so much milky smoothness

Get da "5 degree bubba". The milky smoothness is insane! Not sure how they did it, but's so addictive. No wonder there are so many customers there! Especially the little ones, who seem very much drawn to the fact that you can "self serve" bubba/jelly from a counter before getting the cup filled with tea! The wide "fat" cups also look nice--I've only seen this at purple kow, which is also another amazing tea place.

Must. Get. Moar!
author: Henry L.

description:
It's good. Super convenient for this neighborhood. Price is okay. Taste of milk tea and fruit tea are both okay. About the same kind of quality as tapioca express or quicklys which is fine considering location.

Cash only.
author: Mimi T.

description: This place is no muss, no fuss. Great selection of milk teas, boba drinks, and smoothies. They also have a loyalty card program - buy ten drinks, get one free (they stamp your card with each purchase). Only bummers: 1) they close each evening by 7pm, so if you're late getting to one of the neighborhood dinner spots on this same street, you're probably going to miss out on a choice smoothie afterwards, and 2) they have relatively few seats, so you're hit or miss to be able to get a table. Also, FYI, cash only, which is par for the course for a lot of these small mom and pop shops on San Bruno.
author: Rod V.

description: The drinks are inexpensive but quality not good.  The milk tea is too watery and sweet.  Price equal to the quality!
author: Mable M.

description: This is an okay neighborhood Asian desserts cafe with quite a few food and drink options. They have all the usual milk teas with different flavors, mostly around the $3 and $4 mark. The self-serve counter is a pretty unique offering in the area, and they have specials on the wall that go for $2 including the boba. While it's not the best bubble tea in the world, it's doable as a quick fix, and the tapioca is chewy and soft enough. The food options are commendable and also pretty cheap, ranging from fried snacks to sushi rolls to rice bowls. I also found their honey toast to be pretty tasty and well made.
author: Tony D.

description: Tea was okay, but I asked for the larger balls and I got the smaller balls. Will try again and see what happens. The taro was good though.
author: Gerson K.

description:
The Jasmine Milk Tea is delicious and I am liking it.

Staff members here are friendlier and service is good. This is something that keeps me coming back.

04/08/2014:
Spam Musubi and Taro Milk Tea - a good combo for a quick lunch or snack.

04/16/2014:
The Strawberry Milk Tea tastes good with boba. I tried it with grass jelly yesterday, it was bitter.

04/18/2014:
The waffle is delicious and it is served with whipped cream and a scoop of chocolate ice cream with bananas. Service is quick, staff members are friendly and facility very clean as well.

Here are some of the items I tried from here:
1. Thai Milk Tea
2. Jasmine Milk Tea
3. Boba Milk Tea
4. Taro Milk Tea
5. Strawberry Milk Tea
6. Spam Musubi
7. Eggettes
8. Waffles
author: Bennett W.

description: The drinks they have here are GREAT! I always buy the LARGE for $4.19 - $5.00  Thai Milk Tea, Taro Milk Tea, Mango Smoothie, Taro Smoothie are all GREAT! The California Sushi Rolls were good too!
author: Michael L.

description: First timer and the boba is so chewy fresh! And the taro flavor is on point! Will come again and start my frequent  stamp card!
author: EmmettsGuRL C.

description: Its a very small tea house and there was a lot of people just waiting around. Make sure you have cash--it is a cash only business. They had a special $1.99 that drawn us in to this place to try it out (thats what the 2 stars are for). They also had small snacks on the menu. There were certain tea with boba like thai tea, taro tea, jasmine milk tea etc that was part of the special. If you didn't want the special you could pick out the size you would like once you walk in and fill it with the toppings for your drinks before heading over to the cashier. Kinda cool for the kids to pick their toppings but it was not kept clean or organized. Its wide open and things could easily fall into it. Disgusting. The drink didn't even taste good there was no ice in it and all you could taste was sugar. I ordered the honey dew milk green tea and it was okay nothing special about it. You couldn't even taste the honeydew flavor in it, it tasted more like just regular milk tea.
author: Cindy W.

description:
Food: 
The food here is decent. It's definitely not worth raving over but it hits the spot whenever I'm craving boba. 
Location: 
5 Degree is across the street from Walgreen's. You cant miss the bright green signage in front. Plenty of busses run on San Bruno avenue as well(8 & 9) so it is extremely easy to get to.
Seating:
There are 2 booths along the wall and a couple of small tables and stools by the cart with the straws if you need extra seating. There is also a table and a couple of stools outside on the other side of the window.
Service:
The service here is definitely lackluster and inconsistent. When ordering hot foods, it takes FOREVER for them to finish making it. Meanwhile, other people are getting their drinks handed to them within a couple minutes after paying. I was me. ft there hungry, and wondering if they've forgotten about my order. That happened once actually. I waited there for over half an hour with my friend in the empty store for curly fries that weren't even in oil yet. I finally asked them and the workers all looked at each other confused. They ended up having to heat up oil again to make my food then gave me a fully stamped card as an apology.
author: Connie C.

description:
I really do like their boba and the fact that their boba and food is cheap. However, the food takes a really long time and it's not much when you get it. Another thing is that the place is really small. But I have taken people there and they like it as much as I do. 

It's really great that they only charge you for the size of the drink and they don't add a few cents whenever you put extra toppings on your boba so I think that's really great.
author: Thricia Z.

description: I used to frequent this location back in high school for their original iced milk, which is too sweet now in my opinion. However, this review is about one of my most recent visits. My bf ordered a matcha milk tea and they gave him a regular milk tea. Upon pick up, he noticed that the color of the drink was more brown than green so he asked the barista if the milk tea was matcha, the barista said yes but my bf was still hesitant so he stuck his straw in and it was just a regular milk tea. Seriously? So he brought it to the barista's attention and she just snatched it back. Suddenly all of the workers were yelling at each other in Chinese (as if we didn't understand the language) and saying that my bf claims the drink doesn't taste like matcha. Is this how you provide customer service? First, you lie to us and try to pass off a regular milk tea as matcha milk tea and then you claim that we are making false accusations?? After about 2 minutes of the workers bickering to each other they finally give us another matcha milk tea, this time more green in color and still not the best taste but it's whatever, we were so annoyed with their attitude. It sucks, because this boba place is pretty convenient and I've been a loyal customer for years.
author: Lushi Z.

description:
Tried a few times, has stamp card rewards, staff was friendly and professional.  
Prices are good/standard for milk tea in sf.  The special drinks at lower price and size is a good way to promote drinks.  

Ordered a crema oolong tea but they could not execute a crema and just had a few tablespoons of whipped cream on top.  There was no mistake per staff, pictures on the in store menus show correct image of this type of drink that other places like i-tea can make or you see in Google image search.  The oolong tea itself seemed ok.  

The rose green tea for 1.99 is a awesome deal compared to say San Deigo's Tea Station.  However the recipe or something needs work, it was pink watery tea that was too sweet.  Felt bad but we were unable to finish it.  

The issue facing the consumer is can't you wait to get your boba fix at another store.  Just choose from the best milk tea review lists that can be found online.  Many stores have drinks with a much better taste and only cost 0.5-1 dollar more.
author: Fanshu B.

description: The milk tea is pretty watery and not really sweet. Make sure to ask for lite ice. Boba doesn't taste fresh and is way too chewy (where it gets stuck to your teeth). Pretty expensive for their quality.
author: Chris M.

description:
Pretty cool setup of make your own toppings tea. They have it setup as a self serve where you can put in your cup any toppings you want, then you give the cup to the cashier and tell them your tea choice.
At $2.99 for a 16 oz? The price is pretty reasonable, 

They also have snacks including eggettes, tea eggs and mince pork rice among other things. Really enjoyed their egg puffs

They offer a pretty standard tea variety with the flavors made from powder.
author: Alice C.

description:
Though the drinks here are fine, the honey toast is what truly stands out.

My boyfriend and I stopped by for an afternoon snack, but we ended up skipping dinner that night because the honey toast was so filling. For $7, you get a huge and beautifully put together box. If this isn't Instagram-worthy, then I don't know what is. The bread itself was lightly buttered and perfectly toasted on the outside and soft on the inside. Our Tiramisu Honey Toast included chocolate ice cream, chocolate drizzle, and a small slice of tiramisu cake. The tiramisu seemed like just a bought and frozen cake, and I could tell this by the way the cream tasted a little icy. The ice cream wasn't organic or especially creamy or special, but it's still chocolate ice cream. Who can go wrong with that? The most noteworthy part of the honey toast though is its size, perfectly toasted bread, and beautiful presentation.

The Almond Milk Tea tasted fine. It wasn't overly sweet, but the tea flavor didn't stand out too much either. If you're in the area, the milk tea here should be enough to satisfy any fix.

I'd go back for more honey toast!
author: Tanya A.

description:
I love their honey brick toast. Definitely one of the best place for brick toast, as they'll toast all the individual toast sticks in the center. I wish they'd have more ice cream options or let you make your own toppings on the toast. 
The bubble tea is also good. I always get taro, which taste pretty much the same as (almost) everywhere else. I like that you can help yourself to the amount of boba and toppings you want. I also live nearby, so I go here often when I want boba.
author: Alex L.

description:
Now that the Quickly's nearby has closed due to health issues, this is the only other place that I can get my milk tea/Thai tea fix in San Bruno. The line tends to be quite long and after school hours. At around 1:30 on a Tuesday, the line went out the door with the inside of the small seating quite packed.

I decided to get myself a Thai tea. Service was quick despite the line and I was on my way. It treated good compared to other places and there was a special going on. $1.99 for a decent size drink. Not bad!
author: George Z.

description:
The set up is just like Teaway which I dislike. I rather not allow people to dump their own boba/add-ons into their own cups cos all that stuff is out in the open where people can accidentally sneeze or cough on them. But to each their own I guess? 

I been on a milk tea craze lately and have been wanting to try new things since Tpumps is always full. Coming in, there was already a line nearing the door so I had to wait a bit before I could make my way up to the cash register. I like the fact that they have their cups on the side for people to get along with a line marked on the cup to indicate where people should stop their add-ons. Extra add-ons will cost you about 50 cents more (?). One star off for leaving their straws out in public. They're not even wrapped so I can only imagine what dust had been lying on them. 

The cashier was nice. Not over friendly, but she was helpful to another customer that I saw was struggling with the menu. After paying and telling the cashier what I wanted, I had to wait for my drink. It didn't take long. Maybe about 5 minutes? And that includes standing in line to pay! 

I ordered the honey black milk tea and it was good. A little sour, but still yum and there was even little chunks of peaches in it. Or what I hope to be peaches in it.. 

Overall, this place is decent. I would come back when I'm in the area.
author: Venus L.

description: Fast and quick service. Not too crowded or empty on a Friday. You pick your cup size, proceed to put boba, various jellies or pudding in your own cup then choose your drink. They have smoothies, tea, and many Yukult flavors to choose from. They also have ice cream, desserts, snacks and sushi.
author: Jennifer Z.

description:
I've been here twice and both times the boba was great. I ordered the Thai Milk tea and it was kinda watered down. The bf got the Jasmine was pretty good though. 

Too bad I don't live closer so I can't say it's in a good location. 

Staff is decent in their customer service. We were the only ones there and she seemed a bit impatient. 

Will give them another chance in the future.
author: Vanessa Y.

description:
Only boba place nearby so if you're grocery shopping or grabbing food and crave a refreshing drink, come here. You pick your cup size and scoop the items you want inside at no additional cost if you fill up to their line.. anything past it is 50 cents extra. There's a promo right now for $1.99 for a smaller size cup of Milk Tea with boba. We got the Jasmine milk tea less sweet with boba.

Line started to reach out the door and they move a bit slow. There's also stamp cards you can use towards earning a free drink.

Cash only
author: Lauren K.

description:
This is a convenient boba place on San Bruno for anyone living around the area. The tapioca pearls and jellies are self-serve, which is great since you can choose how much you want and you can mix it up. I usually get a black milk tea and it's pretty good.
However, the boba here is somewhat inconsistent. Sometimes when I come, the black milk tea is not as sweet and tastes watered down. I guess it just dependa on what day you come.
author: Kim H.

description:
I came here because my friend told me they served iced milk. Being that I'm pregnant and all, I've been trying to avoid milk tea, but I cave into my craving every once in a while. Still I feel guilty. So when I heard this place had just ice milk, I was dead set in trying it. It was also near my SF house so it was convenient.

The condiments or extra things you put in your drinks (boba, pudding, lychee, etc) are all self serve. Thought that was kinda weird, but ok. I'm not sure how fresh their ingredients are because my drinks had hard chunks of jelly in it. Their drinks are huge, like the ones they serve at PurpleKow and each drink is between $3-$4. My iced milk drink with pudding and grass jelly was $3.99. It tasted OK. It wasn't too sweet but it lacked something, maybe it's the tea haha. I'd still come back if I was around the area, but I think I'm ready to find other places that serve iced milk.

I also got the eggettes. I thought their eggettes were better than other places, like Eggettes. I think they add extra flavoring to it. It did become soggy within a few minutes which was a bummer. Boo!

I didn't have to wait in line which was cool. The drinks and eggettes were ready in about 4 minutes or so.
author: Rosie W.

description:
The newest milk tea places have either had giant squat cups (inspired by Half & Half Teahouse) or self-serve drink add ins (inspired by Teaway). Five Tea House has both. Most of the drinks are $2.99. They have milk tea, flavored tea, slushes, and yogurt drinks. The self-serve add ins include various jellies, two sizes of tapioca pearls, red beans, etc. For snacks and desserts they have honey toast, crepes, waffles, ice cream, and egg puffs with fried snacks on the way.

* 5 Degree green milk tea ($2.99): The tea part was fine - there was real tea flavor, it wasn't too bitter, it was nice and creamy, sweet but not too sweet. The tapioca pearls weren't good though. They were too hard and not sweetened enough. 

They have a bonus card for drinks.

Cash only.
author: Lolia S.

description:
5 Tea House is a little boba place in Portola.  Loved it!  They have the "chubby cups" (short and stout bucket like cups).  The best part is that you get to choose what you want inside.  So you can mix and match boba with grass jelly or size of your tapioca pearls and well as decide how much you want.  It's wonderful!

As for the tea, it's pretty standard with no surprises, but definitely gets the job done.  I ordered an iced milk with caramel at 50% sugar and it was perfect.  I highly suggest their black milk tea or the iced milk as those were spot on.  Most of all the service is quick and easy and there is relatively no line (besides those eagerly choosing what they want inside their drink).

It's on the corner of a street so parking is difficult to find, but there's not much around so the traffic is not heavy.  If you're looking for an alternative to Purple Kow or those other milk tea shops in the Richmond, this is a great and easy substitute for those with a car that are in the mission area.

5 Tea House also has a plethora of other deserts ranging from honey toast to crepes and more.  I'll definitely be back to satisfy my sweet tooth!
author: Robert T.

description:
Interesting place. I might consider coming here a bit more often and seeing if I'll bump it up to a 4 star.

The place is a little confusing when you first go in. The signs say you get free toppings until the line...and it took me a while to figure out the line was marked on their stacks of cups near the door. Huh. 

Its self-serve tapioca, which is good and bad. Good that you get your own choices. Bad if there's a line and there's people indecisive about their toppings. 

I got the milk tea, as that's my standard for any bubble tea place. This one was pretty good. A bit of tea flavor, and kind of sweet. Similar to Sweethearts milk tea, but a little less tea flavor.

I also always order an eggette if they have one. This...was not as nicely done. Kind of cake-like, with little crisp. I wanna come back and try their honey toast. If you've had it, please let me know...and save me the trouble of going back (or...if its good, force me to come back...)
author: Lily W.

description:
One of the things I absolutely hate: unsanitary practices especially in an establishment that handles food. Sadly, Tea House is the epitome of that! I've visited quite a few times and have closely observed their hygienic practices and it pains my heart to bump their 4 star rating to 1 star. Of the handful of times I've been here, it's always been packed with elementary school kids shoving their hands in every. single. thing. Straws, utensils, and EVEN the boba bar. Sure, Tea House has no control over their customers, but they DO have control over how to properly keep their products sanitary such as using wrapped straws, keeping the utensils behind the counter, having someone serve the boba behind a glass window etc. Then again, all of this costs money and I highly doubt that they would want to hire more people to keep their establishment clean.. 

Today was the last straw! I saw the guy at the counter handle money with gloves THEN grab the cups by the rim and start arranging them on the counter. No, not by the neck, no not at the bottom, but putting his germ infested fingers on the INSIDE the rim of the cup where the milk tea would eventually settle. I was too tired from finals to even say anything! Needless to say, I won't be back and will happily drive my butt over to Tpumps where I know my drinks will be handled with care!
author: Joyce E.

description:
Finally got to try this place and I'm very satisfied. I'm soooo happy that I don't have to go all the way to tea way to add my own toppings. I do with they had the basil seed things I like but other than that it's hella good. Can't wait to try the honey toast and waffles they have there

I wish they stayed open late on the weekends or something. I'd cop all the time.
author: Jeremy B.

description:
Last time I came here, I ordered some kind of flavored noodles and there was hair in it! I and my family had eaten it halfway until we realized that fact...yikes! Then when my sis ordered their spam musubis, there wasn't any sauce (in the spam musubis itself). Double yikes.

Only thing I like about this place is that they serve a variety of food - I would like to try their crepes one day (hopefully no worker's hair falls in). But if their crepes are also bad, then Japantown I go.
author: Krystal C.

description:
I must say , i love the fact that this place isnt VERYYYYYY crowded like other boba places.
I like the fact that its only .50 cents just to add more and toppings ! and the 5 degree green milk tea was just DELICIOUS ! i would most definitely come back if im craving milk tea !! 
i been to many milk tea places but i never really fell in love. Purple Kow is my favorite boba place right now but the drink i get isnt a milk tea :O

SO THIS PLACE, ITS AWESOME !! AND ITS ONLY A COUPLE BLOCKS from my FAVORITE chinese bakery ! FANCY WHEAT FIELD ! 
its a Win Win ! cant say NO! :D
author: Jenny N.

description:
3$ for whatever milk tea you want with whatever toppings you want
Stick with the regular teas though aka thai, milk, jasmine bc the fruity ones are just too sweet and overpowering.
TEA EGGS ARE SO GOOD HERE
DONT get the crepes. Noobie stuff.
Or the toast box thing. This is not the place.
But overall the service is nice and they always have some hip kpop playing so i like that. ;)
BOBAAA NATION
author: michelle w.

description: The jasmine milk tea was nothing special. It tastes like an average one.  Not as creamy as I would like and just sugary. My drink came out super fast suggesting that it's already made and not fresh.
author: Heejin L.

description:
$2 special for milk tea/gmt/thai tea and boba.
$3 for any drink + jellies/boba/puddings.  
The drinks arn't really anything special, but it's one of the only boba places in the area.  I would definitely avoid fruit teas here because they're REALLY sweet.  The green milk tea here is pretty good, and the thai tea is also ok.

PRICING:  A
Pretty cheap for boba in the city, big portions, and they have the $2 special!

SERVICE:  B
Pretty friendly staff, no complaints about their work.  I just really hate kpop and it plays 24/7 here.

DRINKS:  B
Their drinks are ok - not great and not bad.  The thai tea is bitter here and did not taste as expected.  Their jasmine milk tea is pretty good, but I would avoid fruit teas as they are very strong here (sweet/overpowering)

BOBA:  B
Their boba is the right chewiness and sweetness, but the outside texture is a bit lumpy which bothers me for some reason.
author: Tim L.

description:
Accessibility (Parking / Wait Time)

0/1 Star: Hard to find parking.  Waited 5 minutes to place an order.
_____

Service (Waiter / Cleanness / Ambiance)

0/1 Star: Fast food style.  Poor service. 
_____

Taste (0=Not Edible / 1=Edible / 2=Good (average) / 3=Must Try!)

1/3 Stars: My ice cream had big chunks of ice in it.  The milk tea didn't taste normal, and not for the better.
_____


Overall Experience
1/5 Stars 

_____

Pictures


_____

Last Words
author: Elliott N.

description: I went here with my family for boba. My dad really like this place and he recommended it to us. It was my first time going here so I ask the employee what drink she would recommend and then she recommended jasmine milk tea. I ordered that with aloe jelly and boba. The drink was ok but I did not enjoy it as much as the other boba place I've been to.  For some reason, my drink have an aftertaste that made me dislike the drink. I know that its not the aloe jelly because it was sweet so maybe the boba? I am not sure.
author: Kathleen L.

description:
This is my second visit. Not the greatest place for boba. 

The set up is very similar to Teaway. Instead of telling the cashier what size you want, the second you step foot in the door, you're able to self serve and choose your own size. There are different categories of drinks to choose from and are charged depending on the size. A regular was $2.99 and a large was $3.85 if I recall correctly. 

I ordered a large honeydew milk tea with large boba and green apple jelly and my boyfriend ordered a regular lychee milk tea with a variety of jellies. I personally wasn't fond of the lychee milk tea because it had a sour taste to it. The honeydew milk tea was alright but I've definitely tasted better.

I'm definitely interested in trying their honey toast.
author: Michelle L.

description:
Newly opened Asian tea house on San Bruno 

Cheap and large teas, cheap egg puff (but I didn't try it yet)
author: Long C.

description:
Not the greatest boba place I've been to. Price is average for boba in the city. I could probably make better at home. It's a tiny little place with some seats, so if you're lucky you could just chill here for a while. They also sell crepes, brick toast, and some snack foods.

I guess if you're stuck in the area and need a boba/dessert fix, this would be the place. Far as I know, there's little to no competition in the area. However, if you have a car, I would drive somewhere else to get milk tea.
author: Denise C.

description: Loud, small and crowds space, the milk tea doesn't have any tea flavor to it. The taro milk tea just taste like powdered milk that hasn't been mixed all the way fully and that it's a lavender color. The sushi is always warm for some reason. The spam musubi is a rip off here,you should go to Hawaiian bbq for it down the street
author: Allison K.

description: This place is disappointing. There is no one works behind the counter at this place. There was one person work this place. It took forever to get my orders. They took so long this person left. One of the worst thing about this place is so noisy with the tv which no one watch. It's only on for the staff. How can anyone heard themselves think with all the noise blasting.
author: Chris Y.

description: This review is for boba only. I have actually never been here but my mom likes to walk my dog in the area and pick up boba drinks for everyone in my house. Every time I have had their boba, which was about 5 times, it tastes old and stale. The milk tea itself tastes ok but it isn't fun when you don't get boba. I noticed they make brick toasts and I am totally open to head there and try it myself. I definitely will not be ordering boba and will no longer have my mom get me any next time she goes.
author: Brigitte M.

description: This place has good eggettes and drinks.  Follow the step-by-step for your drink.  Prices are reasonable and there are seats.  No lines!
author: Helen L.

description: Ordered the honey green tea with assorted jelly which was decent & rose green tea with boba but the Boba had a weird plastic/starchy flavor to it. Not my type of Boba.
author: Pam Ela Y.

description:
I love coming to 5 tea house in the odd hours during the weekends where there aren't any school kids around. And my past experiences have been pretty wonderful so far. I LOVE their jasmine milk tea. I'm very happy that this place is here in the Portola area since most boba places that have decent milk tea are all located in the Richmond or Sunset districts. 

The service is very friendly and prompt.
author: Corie Z.

description:
I usually walk here after having lunch at 2546 Café. The fruit teas here are pretty good. I can actually taste tea in the drinks. My usual order is a strawberry black tea with a variety of toppings that are self-served. They have so many toppings: all kinds of fruit jellies, grass jelly, flavored puddings, and tapioca to put in your drink. 

As for the milk teas, they're just plain and regular, nothing special. You can see that they're premade and poured from the fridge behind the cashier. Drinks are made quickly because of this though. Drinks costs about $3 - $4 and they come in that big fat cup that doesn't fit into your car's drink holder. 5 Tea House does offer a frequent stamp card. 

They also have snacks and desserts. I've only tried the egg puffs which have been a special of the month since they opened for $1.99. I wouldn't get food again, but drinks are fine.
author: Karen L.

description:
5 Tea House is a wonderful alternative for those who do not live close enough to Purple Kow. Like Purple Kow, this tea house offers the chubby buckets! There was also no line when we went, and everything was so expedient. I ordered the milk green tea, which was very fresh and not too sweet. The unique thing about 5 Tea House is that you can choose however many additions you want in your cup, including pearls, pudding, grass jelly to name a few. You can get pretty wild! The pearls were a little bit too gelatinous and stuck together, but other than that, the experience was very satisfying. I will definitely be back when I don't feel like venturing out too far to get some quality boba drinks! Another pro is that the staff is so, so friendly.

Tip: be sure to get a stamp card!
author: Hurnan V.

description:
Sugar water.  That's how I would describe the teas.  Compared to the other options nearby,  this is on par or even better!  Ummm but really,  self serve jellies, mushy egg puffs (an off day?) and watery drinks for prices that rival ShareTea, Purple Kow and Honey B?! :/ 

Concept was great,  and so was the lolocup this replaced. (Yay for fresh fruit smoothies)

Guess I should come back to give the other items a try like Taiwan toast or ice milk.
author: Jennifer Y.

description:
Not bad. I admit I do prefer the old lolocup that used to occupy this place better, but what can I say. The tapiocas and jellies are self serve. The line drawn on the cup is pretty low so chances are that you'd want to pay extra for however much tapioca you want. They also have desserts here such as honey toast and waffles, none of which I have tried. I've tried their fin soup and it is just average to these kinds of drinks shops. 
Nothing special. Great to come by for a drink, especially if youre a local.
BTW, those larger diameter cups are horrendous. Difficult to hold, doesnt fit into any cup holders. Is this a cup made for giants?
author: Veronica L.

description:
So I finally had to come try this place after it took over Lolo Cup and after reading good and bad reviews, it was time for a taste test..

I walked into this spot and oh.. wow, what a cozy feeling. Tea house cafe is what it really reminded me of. They have drinks along with a self serve jelly/tapioca station, cups that does not fit into your car cup holders (WTH thought of this concept), snacks, a few tables/chairs to sit and relax if you plan to sit in and Asian pop music for your viewing pleasure on the flat screen.. 

I ended up ordering my usual, Thai Milk Tea with nothing inside bc well I usually don't care for it and my kids only use the tapioca pearls to spit at one another so I choose to have my drinks plain. The drink had a light taste to it, not a bold tea flavor like how Quickly's makes theirs. It was real subtle and once the ice melted it became real bland and tasted really watered down.. ***Nxt time ask for no ice or drink it quick!!

Overall this place gets my 3.5 stars bc they were quick and efficient in getting everyone's drinks out in 3 minutes flat, their self serve boba station and the cozy decor.

FYI:
- Their cups do not fit in your car cup holders so either drink it there, save it til you get home or if you don't mind driving with one hand and your drink in the other, then GOODLUCK :)
- Metered street parking available bc you're on San Bruno Avenue
author: Anonymous P.

description: It's not really the best tasting milk tea, but it's not bad either. And when I have a craving, I need something fast, and conveniently close to me. This place does it for me. I think milk teas are a tad watered down, but they do give you that huge ginormous cup. And for some reason lately, I've just been super addicted to their jelly toppings. I've gotten milk tea twice here last week. I have a problem, a jelly and chewy balls in my mouth problem. YEAH. That's right.
author: April D.

description: Their service is rlly fast & they're so kind. I love 5 tea house & I recommend everybody to go!! (:
author: Faith L.

description:
Too expensive and it doesnt taste so good.
Quickly is cheaper and taste better.

Visited one time only.
author: Che K.

description:
I never even realized Lollicup has been replaced by 5 Tea House until yesterday. My friend and I came here around 6pm and the place was pretty quiet. They are running a special for Milk Tea, Jasmine Milk Tea and Taro Milk Tea for $1.99 with boba toppings. Like many other places in the city, 5 Tea House pretty much has a similar menu with different toppings to choose from for your drinks. They also have the bucket cups like Purple Kow offers. They also serve Asian snacks and small appetizers like egg puffs, tea eggs, rice noodles, imitation shark fin soup, etc. 

I ordered the taro milk tea and it tasted okay for $1.99, it wasn't too sweet like other places make it. The boba wasn't too soggy or too hard, it was just right. I also got an order of their egg puffs and surprisingly it didn't taste that bad. It could be a bit crunchier on the outside and a bit more cooked on the inside, but overall it was good. I've tried egg puffs from other dessert  places and tea houses and non of them was edible to me, besides Eggettes. But 5 Tea House kinda has it on the spot. 

I wish they didn't close so early daily (7pm). But I will be back for more milk tea and snacks whenever I am craving again. Now I don't need to drive all the way to Sunset or Richmond!
author: Jenny G.

description:
Not too bad.

The regular 5 degree BMT wasn't horrendous, it was actually pretty good.

Honey lemon black tea is very watered down. 

Egg puffs for cheap, large amount, different from eggettes but in a good way.
author: Gary W.

description: OK.  Nothing special.  I had the milk tea and it really wasn't anything special.  The boba wasn't consistent either..like, some were not thoroughly cooked while others was sorta mushy. ew
author: Audrey C.

description:
This place is pretty cool! My first self-serve tapioca tea house! There was a bit of a wait there especially right after school or on the weekends. 
When you walk in, you grab one of these giant tubs (Yes, I call them tubs cuz they are HUGE!!). Then you fill up your tub with a variety of toppings - bobas, all kinds of jelly, pudding, rice tapioca.... You can fill up to 1/4 of the giant tub for free! Don't you think 1/4 is too little.. it's plenty to fill your belly!
Then you tell them flavor of tea/smooth/milk tea of you choice and there you have it - your own customized tapioca drink!! 
They also sell snacks such as chinese tea eggs, egglettes.. We got the egglette, it was alright - I've had better ones. It was a bit too saggy.
author: Julisa L.

description:
The place is improving, but still needs some work. I went here when this place first opened and the cups were flimsy and smaller than what they use now. The lids were not sealed using the machine, but were just push-down lids, which were not properly closed the first time I purchased a drink here and I ended up with some tea dribbling down my shirt. Cups are much better now.

I must agree with others on the employees' sanitary practice. Hopefully, they'll know to improve on this.

I ordered a Taro Milk Tea the other day and it tasted pretty good, but I could definitely feel the powder swooshing around in my mouth. No bueno!

The place needs some work, but I like where it's headed. They seem to be learning with each month.
author: Reanna T.

description: Not a fan. Good to help quench your thirst but the tea tasted as if it was made from powder; not so fresh. There is no roasted oolong so I'd pass.
author: Marlene T.

description: Noticed Lolocup has became Tea House when I was parking in front. I decided to give this place a try so I got their five degree milk tea which was $2.99 which was pretty big for what you pay for where it was not watered down or being too sweet. They also have have self service add ons where you can add you own boba, jelly, etc. At Tea House they actually make your drink fresh but the downside is that they use powder and tastes similar to their competition on San Bruno.
author: Peter C.

description:
3.5 stars.

My friend bought me a watermelon slush with boba, which was light and refreshing. It was lightly sweetened so that was a plus. My only complaint was the boba. It was a little on the hard side -- I wish it was chewier. Other than that, the drink wasn't bad. I'm not a huge fan of slushy drinks so I'll definitely give their milk tea drinks a try if I'm in the area.
author: Annie S.

description: Not as good as it was anymore, hated how they had to ask me what drink I ordered when they just took my order. Nothing special about the curry fish balls & the eggetes were kind of burnt. The milk tea is decent.
author: Suki L.

description:
I wanted some boba and this was the only option aside from Quickly's.

I ordered the peach milk green tea with regular large boba. The tea was very watery, there's more fruity-flavoring and sugar than milk itself. I definitely do like my drinks to be clear and refreshing on a hot day but this doesn't cut it.

The seats here really suck. They are uncomfortable and dirty. The two booth tables are always taken by hoards of loud middle and high school kids. The other tables on the window side are small and dirty, and the chairs are horrible to sit on because they have no backing.

I was studying here (Yeah, I know. It's my fault for expecting an Asian boba shop to be like a library cafe.) and the entire experience was just a big fail. :X However, there's free WiFi. You just need to ask for the code.
author: Anna F.

description: They have $2 specials :) but cash only :( their jasmine green milk tea was pretty good. It tastes better than their regular milk tea. The boba was pretty basic. Not honeyed like most places nowadays. there aren't a lot of milk tea places in this area and i cant be picky when its just $2
author: Kristina L.

description: Taro milk tea is the best milk tea I tried in there.
author: Amelia D.

description:
They have everything you could want for all three meals! Their waffles, toast, and crepes are huge, masterfully put together, and are only $5. They have a few sushi rolls which are pretty decent and only about $3. As for their milk tea, it isn't the cheapest, but there are a ton of options and the boba/jelly chunks, of which there are many, are "buffet style". The store is comfortable and clean and the staff are nice.

Will continue to go.
author: Seamus F.

description:
Pretty good compared to Quickly, which is the only competitor in the area. Milk teas tend to be on the sweeter side, but I like that you can customize your toppings. The boba itself is nice and chewy, but not overcooked. 

Heaven forbid there's more than 3 customers in the shop though. You'll be waiting 15 minutes to get one drink. They also recently got around to getting their own branded cups, which are more akin to small takeout soup bowls, so beware, because it ain't gonna fit in yo' cupholder.
author: Amy C.

description: Although this place is very inexpensive, the drinks aren't good. I ordered the Thai milk tea, and it tasted nothing like it, it was a very artificial flavor that wasn't even close to the real thing and very watered down. The boba doesn't taste very fresh either. I only gave this two stars because of how cheap it is for the larger cups. Ya get what you paid for.
author: Katie F.

description:
Came here for the first time with my nephews and got their Jasmine milk tea from which we agreed was good! 

So I brought my boyfriend and three other friends to try, only to deceive them! A friend got Taro milk tea, and since he's not milk tea savy he said it was good, two friends who usually drink  Milk tea and said "Meh". And it only gets worst, the boyfriend, got one of their Iced Milks which was the worst thing ever! YES "thing" because that should NOT be a drink! It was watered down and powdery and absolutely no milk taste, color OR consistency, how ironic that it's name was iced milk.
author: Oriel F.

description:
Got a regular milk tea. They have a self serve boba station that also includes many colors of puddings and jellies to add to your tea. The cups have a line drawn on them to indicate how much of the ingredients you can add into your drink. They only have one size of cup, which are the large fat ones. I would've preferred a smaller size. My drink came out to $3.26.

The tea itself isn't particularly fresh as you can see their pre-made batch in the fridge behind the counter. It didn't taste half bad though. I hate it when they make it too sweet but this one had a good balance. Their tapioca is pretty good, nice and chewy. Their pudding is ok. I guess I'd come back another time if I were craving boba but the place didn't really wow me. They seem to have food options too, I might give those a try.
author: Sannie L.

description:
My favorite tea stop WARNING this place is addicting they have all sorts of tapioca the small and the big ones the customer service is great and I The also have like rainbow different type of flavors of Litchey I think it's called but this is my favorite place I can go here every day if I could but I will 
Try to just go three times a week everything is great even the location only thing it's hard-to-find parking sometimes they also have different side order things you can get ice cream for only a dollar a one scoop..
author: Araina S.

description: I ordered imitation shark fin soup and when they gave me it there was two in the bag. I told her out of my kind heart that I only ordered one, which I could have scored an extra one for free. The lady took  one out, ignored me, and went on telling the other lady who packed it that i only ordered one. No thanks or sorry? I left the place feeling I should have kept my mouth shut and kept both of the fin soups. I put red vinegar in my soup and left. When I drank it, it was completely watered down. Sure it was packed with mushrooms and such but it lacked flavor. I would have been mad if I paid more for it but good thing they're having a promotion since this place is new. 2$ fin soup, $2 egg puff, $1 ice cream. Oh and there's only two tables for people to sit at.
author: Julian Y.

description: I really like this place! I tend to get the basic flavors I get from nearly every boba place, taro and caramel if they have it, and those are so good here. However I've made bold moves of trying other flavors they have and they aren't so good. For example, the strawberry one tastes really weird, I ended up throwing it away, and so did my friend. Every once and a while they'll let the place go unkept and it bothers me. Other than that the place is pretty cool, it's convenient because it's so close to my house.
author: Mellany Q.

description:
So I went and it was alright! I mean we're talking about a huge large pint of boba for crying out loud for about less then 5 bucks. Who wouldn't love a HUGE cup of boba to start their day off?

The concept is great for what it is cause there isn't one like it (5 stars for that). BUT ok lets face the facts about this place. 

They use sharpies to draw on the cups to where you can fill the jelly/ boba to, but why re-stack it again? What if there is still wet ink on it then your re-stack the cups now you got a sharpie marks on the inside of a clean cup. YUCK! 

And I agree with one of the reviews, by health code practices, if you got gloves one for one thing like handling money or cleaning, take the thing off and put some new ones on TO FIX MY DRINK! NASTY! Don't use the same one. The time I went the gal who was handling the front had gloves on, she was taking my money with it, wipe down the counter with it still on, then took a new batch of boba to place in on the counter with the same gloves. 

If your one to care less on how your food was handled by all mean go for it, if you get sick I don't know what to tell you. 

Would I go again, no ill take by business to a place I know that runs their business in a very clean fashion. 

Ain't nobody got time for that!
author: Conchita B.

description:
My favorite is the Jasmine Green Tea with Boba.  The drinks are reasonable and the honey toast is yummy.

Just like Tea Way in Sunset, when you pour in the bobas and jellies, there will be an extra charge is your over the black line on your cup.

They are very busy during after-school hours but they get the stuff out pretty fast.

Parking is difficult and I often have to drive around to find parkings.
author: K L.

description: I hate to give a bad review, but this was the worst honey dew milk tea that I have ever had! It taste like honeydew but had an after taste of coffee or chocolate, I couldn't make it out to be exact. Instead of the pastel green color that I am use to this was a tannish brown. I don't know if this is normal for them or maybe someone made a mistake or didn't rinse out whatever container was used to make the previous order. Whatever the case, I will not be returning or recommending. Too bad since I only live a few blocks away. I guess I'll stick to quickly which is just down the street. I was really excited to discover this place, but my excitement quickly turned into disappointment as I was let down!
author: Maria L.

description: Average boba place. Not sure what happened to the original girl who seemed to be the owner, I never see her anymore. The current workers are slower. The drinks are still good. They introduced other sizes as well. Cash only and there is a frequent buyer card.
author: Shirlene K.

description:
actually I changed my mind, this place isn't that bad anymore. The lady who worked behind the counter was very nice and friendly. :D
I got a passion fruit green tea. 3.5/5
& a honey toast, sorry I forgot which one I got but it was the one that cost the least. It's was very filling and delicious! 4/5
will be back for more honey toast. MUST TRY THEM ALL! :3
author: Amy J.

description: We had been getting our boba fix from this place ever since they opened a couple years ago. $3 drinks with any kind of desserts you want to add to it. I loved their milk tea or taro drinks. Taste is very consistent. The drinks come out super quick too. Try all of those toppings. I love their boba, jellies and those colorful puddings.(that's pretty much everything) They also have some other snacks too but the drinks are where it's at!
author: Aung O.

description: The snack is cheap but delicious, the ambiance is ok. No card just cash only. The sushi rock n roll is only $3.75 and 8 pcs.  Lots of drinks to choose from.
author: Ron G.

description: Decent price. I like that you get to pick your own toppings. They have the stamp cards but I always forget to bring it with me :/  They now have a $1 off coupon(for next purchase) when you spent $5
author: Amy Z.

description: Not the best place for milk tea. The only thing that's going for them would be the size and the nice interior with the seats. There aren't too many boba places in this area, so I guess if I really need a boba fix, I would come here.
author: Cynthia D.

description: I love this place so far! Everything taste fresh. San Bruno Ave needed a better tapioca place and this is it!
author: Rachel Z.

description:
Disappointing place! Drove by and saw its new so decided to give it a try. Ordered a milk tea, mango black tea, herbal tea egg, and an eggetts.

-milk tea $3: taste just like quickly which they only cost $0.99. Taste powder made. 
-mango black tea: taste so so! Got some kind of tea flavor but also got some weird taste
-herbal egg $1.25 for 2: just white eggs that taste salty! Suppose to be dark color cuz its boiled with tea but its just plain white egg! 
-eggetts $1.99: the worst of all! Its soggy (after 2 minutes) and ugly! U wont wanna eat that when usee it. Its cheap but also very nasty! Even quickly got better eggettes!

Never gonna come again. Its cheap but still not worth it! Such a poor tea house!
author: Ada L.

description:
The watermelon juice , egg puff , passion fruit tea and the coconut milk tea is Bomb 
But the crepe, DO NOT TRY. EVER. It's soggy, smells stale , TASTE STALE. You're paying 5-6dollars basically for a scoop of ice cream and barely any fruit....! 

My go to drink is the watermelon juice. Never disappoints. Their milk tea is a little too sweet for my taste.
author: D. C.

description: Pretty decent milk tea place if you live/work in the area, especially since the only other option is a Quickly's (which I always try to avoid). You pick the size you want and fill with whatever toppings you want up to the marked line they have. They also serve desserts and some snacks if you want something to accompany your drink. Service sucks unless they know you and since it's across the street from a bus stop, it can get busy at certain times (especially after school lets out).
author: Kitty K.

description: I ordered a Strawberry Smoothie and it was so yummy! I didn't know how it worked, so I asked the worker and she was so nice on explaining it. The service was really fast, and the drink was sweet, the way I like it! I will definitely come back!
author: Sabrina L.

description: This place is pretty cute. They have chinese variety shows to keep customers interested and entertained. A regular milk tea is like $2.99 +tx. There's not much taste to the milk tea -it was just very milky. But I liked the tapioca and jello add-ons. I would not recommend because the drink is very tasteless and more expensive than the usual milk tea places. I haven't tried any of their food items but they have a good variety.
author: Carmen L.

description: Every time I go to 5 tea house, I would get the jasmine milk green tea. It's to die for.
author: Doris X.

description: This used to be lolocup! They remodeled it into Teahouse! But anyways, it's hard to find parking because it's San Bruno but I ordered their Milk Tea and it's goood! It tastes way better then ChaTime! And their service was quick and nice. I love their boba, it's similar to quicklys and tpumps in a way. This place is a must come back! It's right down the street from where I live and delicious! :)
author: Sandy C.

description: Friendly staff with smiles for an asian place. Thumbs up for that. Cool little place. Drinks are very mediocre. Standard Black Milk Tea is okay..Green Milk Tea not so good
author: Royal B.

description: First try wasn't so great, I always come back to a newly discovered place twice, and to my surprise their teas were actually pretty good!  The teas were fresh, and flavorful and not so sweet, just right.  The self service jellies and tapioca was pretty good, I would considered this an alternatives to Purple Kow...much closer to were I live and fresh teas unlike powder teas that Quickly uses.  I will definitely recommend and come back and try other stuff.  3 stars for flavor and 1 star for service and the fact you can add your own stuff to your drinks. :-)
author: Huy N.

description:
I love the size of the cups- they're about equivalent to the size of a large at Quickly's. Tapioca isn't that great.. but oh well.

I'm just here to rave about the Peach Green Milk Tea which tastes EXACTLY like T-Pump's version of Peach Green Milk Tea. It's just a little sweeter but I'm okay with that because it's soooooooooooooooooooooooooooooo gooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooood!

i lahv this place
author: Danielle Y.

description:
I love this place! I just wish it was bigger so there's more room to sit.

I love how you can add in your jelly and tapioca before you order because it saves time. The workers there are really efficient and my drink is prepared fast. I love their flavored milk tea! It's worth the price. This place only has one size but it's pretty big so it's worth the price! If you live in San Francisco, you don't have to travel the distance to T-pumps for flavored milk tea anymore! Can't wait to come back here!
author: Jackie L.

description: 5 stars because of the awesome boba, great selection of jellies, many different drinks, and all kinds of yummy food. they have spam musubi. what else do i need to say? spam. musubi. their minced pork rice and curly fries are also really good. they also have sushi, and tea eggs which were super good too. the price is super reasonable, even for the food. my friends and i go there regularly to buy boba and food. i also had some of their honey toast which looks beautiful and tastes beautiful too. i like that you can choose the flavor of the ice cream to put on top of the toast. and the toast is cut up into little cubes which is perfect finger food and convenient for sharing. 10/10 awesome place
author: Maxine L.

description: Happened upon this place by accident. Great looking place, small but cool vibe. Drinks are really tasty and so was the pork and rice. They had a killer looking ice cream castle thing, with fruit and whipped cream, but i'm trying to lose weight so i waited.  I would definitely go back to take advantage of their boba drinks again. Yummy!
author: Pavle R.

description: Honestly this place isn't the best or the worst, but it fills that gap when you want milk tea. Try not to come here after school ends which is around 3, this place gets crowded. They have plenty of snacks on the menu like honey toast, curry fishballs, and tea eggs. As for the milk tea it can be a hit or miss, one day the milk tea tastes great and other day it tastes watered down and bland. Overall this place is pretty good if you're around the area, but there are way better places in the city.
author: B C.

description: Drew a line on the cup marking where one should stop adding toppings.   Doesn't tell you that they charge more of it goes over.  They just do it at the register hoping you don't notice.  Got the Thai Tea and it was watered down.  NO THANKS!
author: Domino P.

description: First time trying this place. Very disappointed. Both tea drinks we ordered are nasty. Toooo sweet and has a weird flavor
author: Jenn T.

description:
i would be giving this place 1 star if the worker hadn't been nice enough to make my drink sweeter when I asked her too, even though it didn't help the drink at all. 

I got the mango green milk tea and all I can say was it was gross and not nearly as good as tpumps mango GMT! After i tried my drink I asked the worker if I can make it a little sweeter which she did but when I got it back and tried it, it tasted absolutely the same. So I got home about 30mins later and the drink looked as bad as it had tasted the tea and milk separated Like oil would with water GROSS.
Never again!
author: Jia Yi Y.

description: I asked for a black milk tea, she asked if I wanted milk. I  Said yes, but the lady made it without milk. I asked if they put nutella in their crepes, the girl said they can make it with nutella, but when I got home, there was NO nutella in the crepe. Plus, the crepe skin was tough, hard, and stale. The texture was like raw thick egg roll skin. I couldn't even cut through it. It didn't taste good at all. Waste of money.
author: H. A.

description: Gave this place a try when I first move to this neighborhood 5 months ago, this place has similar style with Teaway because they let you pick your toppings first then you order whatever you want to drink. There are also snacks on menu like crepes and egg puffs. OH btw now they have fat cups like Half & Half and Purple Kow, the milk tea was good, I always get the mango black milk tea with lychees because the tapiocas is kinda hard.. It usually takes couple minutes to get your drink so it's pretty fast! You can add your topping up to the line they drew on the cup for free, anything more than that would be $0.50. Most drinks are $2.99 so I guess it's an okay milk tea place if you live around this neighborhood and you don't wanna go all the way to Sunset and Richmond for your milk tea cravings!
author: Anna C.

description: Toppings are sitting outside so you can add what ever you want into your cup.  I don't like that because I don't feel it's very clean when people are digging through it.  So I always order the tea without any topping.
author: Jimmy S.

description: This place just opened up around my neighborhood, so i went with my friend to give it a try! The service was terrible, and the Chinese lady working there had no clue what she was doing. Their flavors for their crepes and waffles aren't that interesting, and their ice cream is very icy. (the ice cream tasted like it was in the freezer for 2 weeks) I only come back to this place for their Regular Milk Tea. It's probably the best I've tried. If you ever come here, don't waste your time with the food, just get the milk tea.
author: Polisha W.

description: their milk teas are better than quickly. I usually get my favorite taro milk tea with red bean. It's really good.
author: Lena P.

description: The milk tea was SUPER watered down and the boba was really horrendous.. it was really stiff and the station for the toppings were all mixed together and the entire experience was just
author: Trisha L.

description: The tea is too sweet for my taste, but the place is always clean and bright. The hand-dipped ice cream cones for $1.00 are the best deal and definitely worth a drop by.
author: Ruth W.

description: I need to change my review since going back several more times. The two young people that work there are so nice. I guess the older lady which is either the owner should take a clue from her kids about service. The teas are great and the desserts are amazing.
author: Neal C.

description: this new place that took over lolocup is so bad. i mean the only cool thing is the boba bar but the boba taste disgusting. its all hard and tasteless. the eggpuffs are close to raw on the inside and burnt on the outside. the store itself reminds me of icrave because tea house has the same desserts and drinks. its just that the drinks at tea house are overpriced and watered down. i can see all the premade milk teas in the fridge behind the counter, this si why others say the service is fast and good. all they gotta do is pour that premade watered down milk tea into a cup. never coming here again
author: Jason W.

description: Milk tea just ok. Worst egg puffs I'd ever had! Only come here because there's no other boba place around. The $1.99 special boba milk tea is a rip off, so little amount of boba in it...
author: Y Y.

description: This review is only for their milk tea and tapioca. This place is definitely better than quicklys. They have their own printed logo cups that are resemble purple kow's cup very much. They tend to give really little ice so i always ask for extra ice. Parking is a little bit difficult because its on San Bruno. They don't really open at 9 a.m like yelp says. It's more like noon. As for closing time, I wish they close a little later like all the tapioca/dessert places. It'll be great because there's a lot of kids in this neighborhood that has to go out of their way to get dessert in sunset or Richmond. They also offer shark fin soup, toast box and egg puffs! I will have to try it soon if they decide to open later since its a snack/dessert type of food.
author: Karen T.

description: The cup size is similar to Purple Kow.  You can choose what you want to put in it such as jelly, boba, etc just like Tea Way.  I got passion fruit tea, taste was ok, can't complain with the price.
author: Lee C.

description: Was walking down San Bruno Ave one day and noticed 5degree took over Lolocup, tempted to try this new Boba shop i went and got a regular milk tea with a open boba bar! Everything looked so good, but man was i fooled.. The Milk Tea was over priced for some watered down premade drink that simply tasted like milk water.. Boy was i disappointed i wish Lolocup was back at this spot as you can simply see all the premade drinks they have in the fridge behind the counter.. The boba also was tasteless and straight up disgusting it looked any where from fresh.. When i hear people compare it to Tpumps and what not it makes me want to throw up that disgusting drink i had.. Then another night i was walking buy with a buddy hunting for some desert  and this place was packed and smelled wonderful, so i hoped that the food was a whole lot better than their drinks but damn was i let down again.. The egg puffs was burnt on the out side then way too doughy and uncooked inside.. In all this place is totally not worth the hype.. I would make the walk a block or two down to the Quickly's for their drinks or snacks..
author: Aaron L.
